	We are seeking an experienced and results-driven Site Engineer to oversee and manage daily on-site construction activities.

	Proficient in AutoCAD, MS Project, or similar project management tools.
	Strong leadership, communication, and team coordination skills.
	Solid understanding of Nigerian building codes and construction best practices.&nbsp;

Site Engineer Job at Ral Entwurf Limited




        
    

        
        Ral Entwurf Limited is a premier design and construction firm based in Lagos & Edo state, Nigeria. The company is renowned for its client-centric approach and exceptional service delivery. Established nearly a decade ago, the company has built a solid reputation for excellence in the industry.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Site Engineer

Job Location: Benin, Edo

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking an experienced and results-driven Site Engineer to oversee and manage daily on-site construction activities.
	The ideal candidate will possess strong technical expertise, leadership skills, and a proactive approach to problem-solving.
	This role is critical to ensuring that all project activities are delivered on time, within budget, and to the highest quality and safety standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Supervise and coordinate all site activities and subcontractors.
	Interpret and implement technical drawings, specifications, and BOQs.
	Ensure compliance with project designs, quality standards, and regulatory requirements.
	Conduct daily site inspections and generate progress reports.
	Liaise with consultants, contractors, vendors, and suppliers.
	Manage site resources including materials, equipment, and workforce.
	Resolve technical issues on-site promptly and effectively.
	Enforce strict adherence to HSE standards.
	Provide regular updates to project leadership and stakeholders.


Requirements


	B.Sc. in Civil Engineering, Building Technology, or a related field.
	Minimum of 5 years of hands-on experience in site engineering or construction supervision.
	Proficient in AutoCAD, MS Project, or similar project management tools.
	Strong leadership, communication, and team coordination skills.
	Solid understanding of Nigerian building codes and construction best practices.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Personal Assistant to Senior Cleric",
  "description": "Lington &amp; Bernie Consulting Limited was established on October 8, 1999 to provide efficient and qualitative consulting services to the oil and gas industry as well as banks and financial institutions in the areas of human resources placement and management, human resources consulting services, tax administration and payroll services as well as oil and gas fiscal and contractual terms advisory services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Personal Assistant to Senior Cleric

Job Location:&nbsp;Marina, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are seeking a highly organised, dedicated, and professional Personal Assistant to support the Senior Cleric in his duties within the Anglican Church.


Key Responsibilities


	Provide administrative support to the Bishop, ensuring the smooth operation of day-to-day activities.
	Manage and maintain the SeniorCleric calendar, including scheduling meetings, events, and appointments.
	Handle correspondence, including emails, phone calls, and letters, ensuring timely and appropriate responses.
	Assistancewith the preparing and organising of church services, meetings, and special events.
	Maintain confidential records and documents related to the Senior Cleric&rsquo;s role.
	Coordinate travel arrangements and logistics as required.


Qualifications


	He must be an Anglican
	He must know how to speak Yoruba
	Proven experience as a personal assistant or in a similar administrative role.
	Strong organisational and time-management skills with keen attention to detail.
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	Discretion and ability to handle confidential information.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
	Familiarity with the Anglican faith
	Proficiency in office software, including Word, PowerPoint, spreadsheets, and email management.
	A calm, professional demeanour and the ability to work in a dynamic and sometimes demanding environment.


Desirable Skills:


	Experience in a church or faith-based organisation.
	Knowledge of Anglican liturgical practices and terminology.
